paper_abstract: This article proposes a mathematical model and a branch-and-price algorithm for the multivehicle covering tour problem. This problem consists in finding a set of routes on a weighted graph such that a set of nodes that cannot be visited is covered. A node is covered if it lies within a predefined distance of a visited node. The subproblem encountered during the column generation is a variant of the profitable tour problem. It is reduced to a ring star problem and a branch-and-cut algorithm is developed. Computational results are reported on randomly generated instances. (c) 2014 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. NETWORKS, Vol. 64(3), 160-168 2014
paper_title: A Branch-and-Price Algorithm for the Multivehicle Covering Tour Problem
